Job Title: Principal Business Analyst multiple positions available
Category:
Business/Systems Analysts (Information & Communication Technology)
Government - State (Government & Defence)
Ad Text:
Digitally Enabled Business Solutions, within the Delivery Service Branch, eHealth Queensland is leading several initiatives that will modernise clinical and/or business applications across Queensland Health, Hospital and Health Services.  These initiatives are in the detailed planning stage, focused on the development of detailed business cases and associated detailed planning activities. This exciting work will enhance patient engagement and access to services, and support modern healthcare deliver for all Queenslanders. 

The initiative is seeking multiple Business Analysts to lead work to support the definition of the program analysis deliverables. The Business Analysts will be required to ensure the successful delivery of analysis deliverables which may include:

leading the analysis and documentation of current state processes / practices, business rules and system usage*
leading the co-design and documentation of future state processes / practices to support the program vision
leading the identification of business change impacts and relevant interventions to support effective outcomes across all Queensland Hospital and Health Services.
working collaboratively with program and operational stakeholders to define the information management practices that support current and future state processes.

*While not compulsory, knowledge of the existing patient administration systems used within Queensland Health, would be highly regarded, specifically HBCIS and/or related downstream clinical or business systems.

Is this opportunity for you?

To be successful in this role, you will be able to demonstrate:

experience leading and managing business analysis activities, including data migration, within complex project(s), preferably in the health care industry. (SFIA Skill: BUAN: Level 5).
Experience leading business process modelling activities for large scale complex organisations, preferably using Business Process Modelling Notation (BPMN). (SFIA Skill: BSMO: Level 5).
High level knowledge and application of, appropriate business analysis frameworks, and an ability to promote and provide advice on use of appropriate techniques, methodologies, and tools, preferably aligned with Business Analysis Body of Knowledge Version 2.0 (BABOK). (SFIA Skill: METL: Level 5).
Proven high level negotiation, consultation, facilitation, and effective written and oral communication skills for use in a complex program/project environment. (NHS: Effective and strategic influencing).
Ability to lead, manage and mentor a multi-disciplinary project team. (NHS: Collaborative working).

While not mandatory the following qualifications and experience would be well regarded:

A relevant qualification.
Proven experience and working knowledge of PAS and / or electronic Medical Record (eMR) within a large, complex and distributed health care environment

We have an ambitious plan, and we are now seeking digital enthusiasts who are forward thinking problem solvers that thrive in dynamic change, enjoy tackling complex challenges and want to reimagine the future of patient administration services. Come and join our purpose driven team and have a huge and lasting impact!

Benefits of working with eHealth Queensland:

By joining eHealth Queensland, you will work within a fast-paced, challenging and supportive environment where every employee plays a critical role in our ongoing success. 

You will enjoy a variety of benefits, including:

Competitive salary + generous superannuation and leave loading
Flexible working arrangements
Diverse work culture
Career training and development

To apply for this opportunity, submit your resume and a short statement (maximum 2 pages) on how your experience, abilities, knowledge and personal qualities are relevant for the role, taking into account the key responsibilities and attributes noted in the ‘How you will be assessed?' section of the role description.

Should you require additional support or reasonable adjustments during our recruitment process to ensure you can demonstrate your ability to meet the inherent requirements of the role, please contact Talent Acquisition Services via email eQH-DSB-TalentAcquisition@health.qld.gov.au

This role is perfect for someone who loves storytelling through data and thrives in a modern cloud data environment.

Description

The Role

You'll work closely with stakeholders across the business to design and deliver impactful dashboards and reports that drive smarter decision-making. The data platform is built on Snowflake, so strong SQL and data modelling skills are essential.

Key Responsibilities

Design, build and maintain Power BI dashboards and reports

Translate business requirements into clear, engaging visualisations

Write efficient and scalable SQL queries on Snowflake

Develop and maintain data models and semantic layers

Partner with stakeholders to understand reporting needs and deliver insights

Improve and optimise existing dashboards and reporting processes

Profile

What We're Looking For

3-5 years' experience as a Power BI Developer

Strong hands-on Power BI development skills (data modelling, dashboards)

Solid SQL skills and experience working with Snowflake

Excellent data visualisation and storytelling capability

Ability to work with both technical and non-technical stakeholders

Strong problem-solving and communication skills

Experience in the mining or resources industry is highly regarded

Job Offer

Salary sacrificing
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Corporate discounts

About Brunel:

Brunel is a recruitment and flexible workforce solution provider which connects talented people with opportunities throughout Australasia and around the world. We specialise in highly skilled roles across a variety of technical, professional, trades and craft disciplines, pairing candidates with industry-leading projects and organisations on a contract, permanent or secondment basis.

Operating in Australasia since 1997, Brunel has major bases of operation in Perth, Sydney, Brisbane, Melbourne and Port Moresby, which are further backed by the strength and reach of a truly global network spanning over 45 countries, 120 offices and 50 years of successful operation.

Brunel is proud to be equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander and female candidates.

Do you have questions?

If you have any questions or would like to discuss the details of this role, please contact Terence on t.gomes@brunel.net

This role sits at the intersection of AI, data engineering and analytics, and is ideal for someone excited about applying LLMs and modern AI tooling to real-world business problems. Help build and fine-tune next-generation AI solutions that support data, reporting and operational insights.

Description

The Role

You'll work within a high-impact data and analytics team focused on improving reporting, data quality and operational decision-making through AI. A key part of this role is fine-tuning and optimising AI models, and integrating them into a modern cloud data platform built on Snowflake.

Key Responsibilities

Design, develop and fine-tune LLM and AI solutions

Build AI-driven workflows that enhance reporting and data processes

Develop and maintain Python-based data and AI pipelines

Write and optimise SQL on Snowflake

Work with large, complex datasets to improve data quality and accessibility

Collaborate with data, analytics and business stakeholders to identify AI opportunities

Contribute to best practices for AI governance, reliability and scalability

Profile

What We're Looking For

Strong Python development experience
Hands-on experience working with LLMs / Generative AI
Strong SQL skills and experience working with Snowflake
Experience building or fine-tuning AI/ML models in production environments

Ideal Experience

Background as a Data Scientist, Machine Learning Engineer or AI Engineer
Experience deploying AI solutions into cloud environments
Exposure to MLOps, prompt engineering or model optimisation
Experience working with reporting, analytics or enterprise data platforms
Experience in the mining or resources sector is highly regarded

Job Offer

Salary sacrificing
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Corporate discounts

Company description:



Insignia Financial Limited is an Australian financial services company which offers a range of products and services including financial advice, superannuation, investment management and trustee services



Job description:


Be part of a major enterprise‑wide CRM transformation as we implement Microsoft Dynamics 365
Design, build, and optimise CRM data assets that power adviser and client experiences
Work with a collaborative delivery team where your data expertise drives real business outcomes



The opportunity to join our team

We're looking for an experienced Data Developer to join our Client Channels Technology team and support the delivery of our enterprise CRM platform. Reporting to the Delivery Lead - CRM, you'll play a critical role in designing, building, and maintaining CRM data assets that enable insight driven decision making across the business.‑driven decision making across the business.

This role starts with a focus on our Advice division and will expand to support other areas of the organisation over time. You'll work closely with product, delivery, and business stakeholders to ensure CRM data is reliable, consumable, and integrated across our technology landscape. Your work will help shape how data flows through Microsoft Dynamics 365, how reporting supports business outcomes, and how CRM delivers value at scale.

You'll contribute across the CRM delivery lifecycle, with responsibilities including:

Designing, developing, and maintaining CRM data assets aligned to business and enterprise standards
Building and supporting SQL based data solutions and end-to-end ETL processes ‑based data solutions and end‑to‑end ETL processes
Executing the prioritised CRM backlog in line with enterprise strategy and delivery guardrails
Creating consumable reports and analytics to support business insights and decision making
Ensuring seamless integration between Dynamics 365 and downstream systems
Working closely with product, delivery, and business stakeholders to understand data requirements
Supporting delivery planning, risk management, and status reporting in line with governance standards
Contributing to continuous improvement of CRM data practices and processes

What You Bring to This Role

To succeed in this role, you'll bring strong technical capability combined with a practical, delivery focused mindset:‑focused mindset:

Experience as a data developer within CRM or enterprise platforms
Hands‑on experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365 or similar CRM platforms such as Salesforce
Strong SQL development skills and experience delivering end-to-end data pipelines ‑to‑end data pipelines
Experience with ETL processes and integrating data across complex system landscapes
Familiarity with data analytics, reporting, and insight generation
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to interpret business needs through data ‑solving and analytical skills, with the ability to interpret business needs through data
Clear and effective communication skills, with confidence engaging with both technical and non‑technical stakeholders
Ability to work collaboratively within agile delivery teams and manage competing priorities

Find the better way

What gets us excited about working here? Helping people feel good about their money as one of Australia's leading financial wellbeing organisations. From those starting out to those retiring. As your team, we'll show up for you and together we will create financial wellbeing for every Australian. Because we know people who are confident about their financial future live better lives.

If this sounds like your kind of career, you sound like our kind of person. With us, you'll do work that builds your technical know-how and challenges our entire industry to move forward. Along the way, you'll be free to explore new ideas and technology, solve problems in a team, and independently to get great things done. Around here, we like to call it "putting our fingerprints on the future".

People-inspired tech

Deep expertise combined with creativity can take on the trickiest of problems. Join our team of brilliant minds and mentors as we explore our way to innovation and apply technology in more human ways than ever.

__

To Apply

Read more here about why you should join our team.

Applicants will be required to provide evidence of their eligibility to work in Australia, and at a minimum be required to undertake police and basic credit checks as a condition of employment.

Please note that applications from agencies will not be considered at this time.

We acknowledge and celebrate the richness that individual differences bring to our team. If you need assistance or an adjustment during the application process, please reach out and let us know.

Join the change. Electrify your future!
We've been proudly Aussie since 1837, always finding new ways to innovate in energy and essential services. Now, we're moving towards a sustainable future through electrification and investing in renewable energy-and we'd like you to join us. Whether you're on-site, in the office, or somewhere in between, you'll find opportunities to grow your career here. You'll work with a team that's passionate about powering Australian lives, in a culture that values inclusivity, respect, and learning. Help us create a cleaner energy future, and we'll back you every step of the way as you build your career.

Join the change. Electrify your future.

About the role
At AGL, we're shaping the future of energy through smarter insights, stronger commercial decisions, and a deep focus on our customers. We're seeking a Commercial Planning Manager to play a pivotal role in driving integrated planning, forecasting, and strategic decision‑making across our Consumer business.

Reporting to the Head of Commercial Planning & Insights, this role leads integrated commercial planning across the Consumer business, supporting both short‑ and long‑term strategic decision‑making. You will act as the commercial lead for the quarterly budget and forecast cycle, owning key planning assumptions and delivering clear, data‑driven insights. Working closely with Finance, Marketing, Operations and other stakeholders, you'll ensure alignment across planning and execution while leading and developing a small, high‑performing team within the Commercial Planning & Insights function.

What you'll be doing:


Develop and deliver integrated commercial plans aligned to AGL's strategic objectives
Own and continuously improve commercial planning, forecasting, and scenario modelling processes
Translate complex data and analysis into clear insights and recommendations for senior leaders
Monitor performance through KPIs, identifying risks, opportunities, and optimisation levers
Coach and inspire a high‑performing team of commercial analysts

About you:

Proven experience in commercial or integrated planning roles, ideally within energy or a related sector
Previous demonstrated leadership experience
Strong analytical capability, with experience using tools such as Excel and SQL
Solid understanding of market dynamics, regulatory environments, and financial drivers
Demonstrated people leadership experience with a collaborative, outcomes‑focused mindset


At AGL, we offer a wide range of benefits including:

Flexible working options including hybrid work.
Discounts on energy, telcos and solar plans.
Participate in Energise - our reward & recognition program.
Access 20 weeks of paid parental leave for the primary carer.
Access to an additional week of recharge leave per year.
Play an active role in our diversity & inclusion initiatives.
Novated leasing and Electric Vehicle subscriptions.
Access to study assistance, AGL's share purchase plan and insurance deals.

*Benefits may change over time and vary based on role type and location.

Inclusion at AGL
At AGL, we value diversity and welcome applicants from various backgrounds, including Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander peoples, individuals with disabilities, culturally diverse individuals, and members of the LGBTQ+ community. AGL is dedicated to maintaining a diverse workforce and encourages applicants to share their lived experiences.
We offer reasonable adjustments throughout the recruitment process and respect the privacy of those who choose not to disclose. To learn more visit: www.agl.com.au/careers

AGL is proud to be a WORK180 Endorsed Employer for All Women.
Our pre-employment screening process includes a Nationally Coordinated Criminal History Check and a medical assessment if necessary.

The information provided as part of your application to AGL will be managed in accordance with the AGL Privacy Policy.

AGL does not accept agency submissions unless approval has been granted by a member of the Talent Acquisition team. Candidates submitted by an agency without approval will not be considered by AGL.



Location

Docklands VIC 3008

Job Family Group

Project Management - Group

Our client is a  leading logistics company based in Sydney's West and they are  seeking an experienced Data Solutions Analyst with a strong background in Power Platform technologies to join their team on a contract basis.

This role focuses on completing and optimizing existing Power Apps and Power BI solutions that underpin their Control Tower initiative, enhancing operational workflows, milestone visibility, and real-time KPI reporting.

Key Responsibilities:
Review, stabilize, and optimize Power Apps components related to operational workflows, improving performance and user experience.
Implement milestone-driven navigation and strengthen data integrity with validation and exception logging.
Evaluate and enhance Power BI datasets to address capacity and refresh challenges, aligning reports with the approved KPI framework.
Develop a harmonized data model supporting real-time exception management and ensure solution resilience even with upstream system disruptions.
Collaborate closely with IT, Transport and Warehouse Operations stakeholders
Required Skills and Experience:
Demonstrated expertise in Power Platform including Power Apps, Power BI, and Dataverse with experience in dedicated Dev, Test, and Prod environments and ALM pipelines.
Strong grasp of API integrations, Azure services and understanding of Snowflake 
Experience in E2E solutions developed in Power Apps and strong SQL
Experience managing data gateways and connectivity for enterprise-scale data sources.
Ability to document complex solutions clearly and produce environment and ALM plans aligned to architectural guidelines.
Experience working with multi-system integration scenarios and managing data quality and performance constraints.

This is a unique opportunity to contribute to a high-impact program within a dynamic environment, applying your Power Platform and integration skills to deliver and enhance a scalable, user-friendly solution supporting critical logistics operations.

This role  has immediate start and will be offered as an intiial 6 months contract engagement

Please send your CV to Silvia at Balance Recruitment





Balance Recruitment is committed to equal opportunity employment.  We celebrate diversity and encourage people from all sections of the community to apply.

Business Analyst - Technical Programs (6-Month Contract)

We're looking for a capable, delivery-focused Business Analyst to join a fast-moving technology program delivering complex system upgrades and transformation initiatives.

This role sits within a highly technical environment, so you'll be comfortable working across technology-led projects, engaging with engineers, architects and delivery leads, and bringing structure, clarity and momentum to complex change.

What you'll be doing

Applying Business Analysis fundamentals to technology projects - getting the basics right and executing them well

Establishing and maintaining strong end-to-end traceability, including requirements documentation and traceability matrices

Working across system upgrades, platform changes and technical initiatives

Partnering closely with Project Managers, Technical Leads and stakeholders to keep delivery aligned and moving

Ensuring the right processes are in place to support quality outcomes and efficient delivery

Taking a solutions-focused approach - cutting through ambiguity and helping teams move forward

Operating effectively in a complex, matrix environment with multiple initiatives running in parallel

What we're looking for

Solid experience as a Business Analyst on technical / technology projects

Strong grounding in Business Analysis 101 - requirements elicitation, documentation, traceability and governance

Comfortable asking the right questions and engaging confidently with technical stakeholders

A genuine can-do mindset - proactive, pragmatic and delivery-oriented

Strong communication skills and the ability to bring people together

Someone who can juggle priorities, adapt quickly and keep the bigger picture in mind

The environment

High-performance delivery culture with an emphasis on quality and pace

Everyone is expected to operate with a leadership mindset, regardless of title

Multiple streams of work running concurrently - you'll need a wide lens and strong organisational skills

Contract role: 6 months

ERP Business analyst for enterprise reporting, BI or analytics platforms
12 + 6 month contract – April 2026 start date
Baseline Security Clearance - Civic, ACT 

Our client, a Federal Government department based in Civic, ACT that supports Australian exporters and the domestic tourism sector, requires the services of a Senior ERP Business Analyst for a 12 + 6 month contract.

Duties of the Senior ERP Business Analyst:

Elicit, analyse and document business requirements across finance, procurement and travel management functions.
Define future-state processes and information flows to ERP standard (“adopt not adapt”) principles. 
Define functional requirements, data requirements and business rules to support configuration and integration. 
Support solution design workshops and validate proposed ERP solutions against business needs. 
Work alongside the development and testing teams to clarify requirements, support build, and resolve issues. 
Support user acceptance testing (UAT), business readiness, data validation activities and go-live transition. 
Assist with change impact assessment, training inputs, user and operational handover stabilisation.

Skills and Experience - Senior ERP Business Analyst:

Essential criteria (SFIA 9 Framework)

BUSA – Level 4
REQM – Level 5
BPRE – Level 4
RLMT – Level 4
BSMO – Level 4

Desirable criteria

Experience with enterprise reporting, BI or analytics platforms.
Exposure to budgeting, forecasting or performance management processes.
Experience working with data models and financial reporting structures.

How to Apply

For a copy of the full job description, including the application instructions, please get in touch with Andy at Recruitment Hive by clicking the Quick Apply button. Alternatively, you can reach Andy on (02) 6299 1006 to discuss further.

Please note that applications close at 11am on the 13th of February 2026. Recruitment Hive welcome late applications to be considered for future opportunities.

Job ID: AE 287888 | LH-05573

Company description:



Insignia Financial Limited is an Australian financial services company which offers a range of products and services including financial advice, superannuation, investment management and trustee services



Job description:


Lead the enterprise-wide CRM transformation, starting with Advice, as we implement Microsoft Dynamics 365.
Shape strategy, influence stakeholders, and deliver a next-generation CRM platform that transforms adviser and client experiences.
Work with Microsoft Dynamics 365 and its AI-powered capabilities to unlock data-driven insights and efficiency.

The opportunity to join our team

At Insignia Financial, we're on a mission to empower Australians to make better financial decisions. Our Advice Technology team is looking for a strategic, delivery-focused Senior Product Owner to lead the implementation and evolution of Microsoft Dynamics 365 as our enterprise CRM platform - starting with Advice and scaling across the business.

This is your opportunity to drive a high-impact transformation, influence enterprise strategy, and deliver real value to advisers and clients. You'll be the go-to expert for CRM strategy, working with passionate teams across the business to bring use cases to life. From leveraging Dynamics 365 AI and data capabilities to building scalable, efficient solutions, you'll help shape how thousands of advisers and clients connect through technology.

Key areas of this role include:

Own the Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM product strategy and roadmap, starting with Advice and expanding enterprise-wide.
Partner with technology delivery leads to shape implementation plans and drive iterative delivery.
Engage deeply with Advice stakeholders to understand workflows, compliance, and adviser-client interactions.
Influence vendor relationships and ensure commercial alignment with strategic goals.
Deliver product artefacts - roadmaps, prioritised backlogs, business cases - and support change management for adoption.
Operate in a fast-paced, agile environment, delivering measurable outcomes and business value.



What You Bring to This Role

To be successful in this role, you'll have:

Proven experience as a Product Owner or Product Manager leading CRM platform implementations in Microsoft Dynamics 365
Deep understanding of financial advice models, adviser workflows, and regulatory obligations.
Strong stakeholder engagement skills - you're a natural influencer and communicator.
Hands-on experience with MS Dynamics 365and a solid grasp of CRM platform components.
Strategic mindset with commercial acumen, and the ability to make decisions that drive impact.
Familiarity with AI, data, and reporting capabilities in CRM environments.
Agile delivery experience and business analysis skills are a big plus.


If you're ready to lead CRM transformation at scale, influence enterprise strategy, and deliver real value to advisers and clients - we'd love to hear from you.

Apply now and help us shape the future of financial advice technology.

Find the better way

What gets us excited about working here? Helping people feel good about their money as one of Australia's leading financial wellbeing organisations. From those starting out to those retiring. As your team, we'll show up for you and together we will create financial wellbeing for every Australian. Because we know people who are confident about their financial future live better lives.

If this sounds like your kind of career, you sound like our kind of person. With us, you'll do work that builds your technical know-how and challenges our entire industry to move forward. Along the way, you'll be free to explore new ideas and technology, solve problems in a team, and independently to get great things done. Around here, we like to call it "putting our fingerprints on the future".

People-inspired tech

Deep expertise combined with creativity can take on the trickiest of problems. Join our team of brilliant minds and mentors as we explore our way to innovation and apply technology in more human ways than ever.

__

To Apply

Read more here about why you should join our team.

Applicants will be required to provide evidence of their eligibility to work in Australia, and at a minimum be required to undertake police and basic credit checks as a condition of employment.

Please note that applications from agencies will not be considered at this time.

We acknowledge and celebrate the richness that individual differences bring to our team. If you need assistance or an adjustment during the application process, please reach out and let us know.

Join a high-performing risk analytics team where you will play a key role in monitoring and improving credit risk models that support critical business decisions. This is an excellent opportunity for someone with a quantitative mindset and strong data skills to work in a collaborative, forward-thinking environment.


The role:


You will be responsible for monitoring the performance of credit risk models, identifying issues, and providing insights that drive model improvements and better decision-making. You will work closely with model owners, developers, and risk stakeholders across the business.
Key responsibilities include:


Generating regular model monitoring results across a suite of credit risk models
Developing monitoring processes for newly implemented models
Reviewing monitoring outcomes and highlighting trends or issues
Providing clear, actionable insights to model owners and developers
Participating in monitoring review meetings with senior stakeholders
Presenting results through effective data visualisation
Supporting internal and external data requests
Maintaining and enhancing monitoring approaches and frameworks
Tracking issues through to resolution
Contributing to broader credit risk and modelling transformation projects
Documenting monitoring processes and procedures
Supporting monitoring of PD, LGD, EAD and IFRS9 models

About you


You have a foundational understanding of credit risk modelling within a banking or financial services environment and are comfortable working with data, models, and frameworks.
Your skills and experience include:
Understanding of credit risk frameworks and model lifecycle concepts
Knowledge of statistical modelling data and monitoring requirements
SAS, SQL and Excel capability
Experience with data visualisation tools such as Tableau
Good understanding of data management and system development lifecycle principles
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work with a range of stakeholders including modellers, data teams, systems teams and offshore partners

What's on offer


Strong career development and learning opportunities
Supportive and collaborative team culture
Flexible working arrangements
Opportunity to contribute to meaningful risk and analytics initiatives

How to apply


If you are interested in applying your analytical skills in a role that combines data, risk and stakeholder engagement, we would love to hear from you. Apply now to be considered.

Job Title: Senior Data Engineer - 12 Month Max Term Contract
Ad Text:
Great opportunity with a top 5 General Insurer in Australia

Be part of a collaborative and innovative data team

Work on high-impact projects that shape business outcomes




About Hollard   

Hollard Insurance is part of the Hollard Group of Companies and a top 5 General Insurer in Australia and New Zealand. We underwrite a broad range of general insurance products, including motor, home, contents, business, bicycle and pet, in proud partnership with some of Australia's biggest consumer brands and broker businesses. As an independent and privately owned company, we believe we can go further together – for our people, customers, communities and partners – through an innovative approach to providing insurance.   

Our state-of-the-art facilities in North Sydney reflect our commitment to providing innovative workspaces that support hybrid and remote work.   

Your Team

You will be part of a multi-disciplinary technology team, working closely with our customers (business, software vendors and partners) and strategic project teams. The team is responsible for the development, implementation and maintenance of the Hollard Data Platform that support our customers through all aspect of the insurance value chain. The team is involved in all aspects from design through to testing, implementation, maintenance and support.

Your Role

As a Senior Data Engineer, you will work in the Data team and actively collaborate in our data journey, providing significant data engineering direction for the delivery of our Azure Data Platform. You will build and maintain data pipelines to ingest data into the Data Platform and support integration into other systems.

Your duties and responsibilities

Maintain, support, and monitor existing production Azure Synapse data engineering pipelines, PySpark notebooks, data platform lake house architecture and Azure SQL ODS storage and Stored Procedures, CI/CD pipelines to make sure all data loads on data platform meet data quality standards and business SLA requirements.

Participate and contribute to Azure data platform architecture design, data modelling, gathering and analysis of data requirements; understand document, communicate and build appropriate solutions.

Participate and contribute to the end-to-end data flow in the Azure data platform – ensuring data quality, efficient processing, and timely delivery of accurate and trusted data.

Coach and mentor data engineers on Azure technologies.

Collaborate and work closely with team members and contribute significantly to building a high performing, collaborative, transparent, and result-driven data engineering team.

About You

Extensive experience in design, build and support of data engineering pipelines in the data warehousing, BI analytics, and/or ML space is required.

Substantial work experience using Azure data analytics tool such as Data Factory, Synapse, Azure SQL, data lake gen2, key vault is required.

Proficiency in PySpark and Apache Spark with Python is required.

Must have excellent communication skills with an ability to build rapport quickly and effectively manage stakeholders.

Experience with CI/CD using modern DevOps / Data Ops integrated processes is desired.

Working at Hollard   

At Hollard, you’ll discover an environment where you can truly make an impact. We offer the best of both worlds – the opportunity, agility and creativity of a company growing with scale, alongside a focus on becoming a catalyst for enduring, positive, social change.   

We’re a tight-knit team, where authentic voices and unique perspectives matter. We work supportively, collaboratively and inclusively to help shape our future and create shared value for our communities.   

Hollard proudly promotes flexible work including remote work, non-traditional work patterns, and work-family balance. We’re also unapologetically committed to creating a workplace that values your diversity with a true sense of inclusion.  We actively seek to hire for your different lived experiences, including as it relates to disability, ethnicity, faith, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples, gender diversity, sexual orientation, age, neurodiversity.   

We’re building something special. Working closely with our industry partners to reshape insurance for the better, we’re people changing insurance.   

Please note:    

Even if you don’t meet all our selection criteria, we encourage you to apply.    

A full background check will be completed on the successful applicant.   

Visit the Hollard careers page to learn about how Hollard will collect, store and handle your personal information.    

We are NOT engaging Recruitment Agencies for this role and ask agencies to respect our policy of no unsolicited contact regarding advertised vacancies.

Category:
Analysis & Reporting (Banking & Financial Services)
Government - Federal (Government & Defence)
Ad Text:
At ASIC, you can be the change that ensures a fair, strong and efficient financial system for the benefit of all Australians. Contribute to delivering on ASIC's purpose, vision, and strategic priorities to help maintain the integrity of the financial system and protect consumers from harm.

 

Join an evolving and stimulating organisation, working on cutting-edge issues that shape Australia's economic reputation and wellbeing. Broaden and deepen your expertise as you make a real difference to our goals and your own career aspirations.

All locations considered
Permanent position
Salary from $152,074 + 15.4% superannuation
Applications close at 11:59pm AEDT, Sunday 22 February

 

The team 

The Sustainability, Financial Reporting and Audit (SFA) team promotes market trust and confidence in the quality of financial and sustainability reports and their audits. The team ensures compliance with the law through financial and sustainability reporting surveillances and audit surveillances, and contributes to policy development, education, sector liaison and other activities to enhance reporting and auditing practices.

 

The role

As a Senior Auditor, you will be responsible for:

Leading and conducting financial reporting and audit surveillances of companies and superannuation funds, engaging with senior executives and audit personnel.
Monitoring compliance with the Corporations Act, Accounting and Auditing standards, and providing expert accounting and audit advice on complex technical issues.
Developing and implementing audit and financial reporting policy, regulatory guides, and instruments to inform the market and influence behaviour.
Building and maintaining professional relationships with stakeholders, including industry groups, regulatory bodies, corporations, superannuation funds, and audit firms, and leading sector engagement initiatives.
Supervising, mentoring, and coaching team members, supporting regulatory functions such as auditor licensing and industry funding, and driving data-driven approaches to deliver regulatory priorities.

 

About you

You are a strategic thinker with strong analytical and investigative skills, able to communicate complex information clearly and persuasively. You thrive in a dynamic environment, building productive relationships and guiding others to deliver quality outcomes. Your ability to manage multiple projects and adapt to changing priorities ensures you consistently achieve results.

You will also have:

A qualification in accounting and professional accounting qualifications (CA ANZ, CPA or IPA).
Significant knowledge of financial reporting and auditing provisions in the Corporations Act, and accounting, auditing and ethical standards.
Extensive practical experience in external financial audit of companies and/or superannuation funds, ideally in a medium-to-large professional accounting firm or regulatory environment.
Experience in planning, coordinating and managing complex projects, including leading financial report and audit surveillances.
Experience providing complex accounting, audit and regulatory advice, including drafting clear, accurate analysis and reports on complex matters.
Current or recent experience in external audit with exposure to current standards and practices is highly regarded and should be addressed in the cover letter.

 

About ASIC

ASIC's remit is one of the broadest of regulators across the world. ASIC regulates corporations, markets, financial services and consumer credit and monitors and promotes market integrity and consumer protection in the Australian financial system. Through our enforcement work, we hold to account those who contravene the law, working to achieve strong outcomes that address the greatest consumer and investor harms.

 

ASIC is an equal opportunity employer seeking people who want to make a difference. ASIC is committed to providing a diverse and inclusive workplace where the very best talent in Australia chooses to work. Applications from people of all ages, cultural backgrounds, abilities, LGBTIQ+ identity, and people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander decent are encouraged to apply.

We offer a range of employee benefits including:

Attractive superannuation
Additional leave entitlements
50/50 hybrid work-from home model
Flexible work arrangements
Assistance for study and professional development

 

To work with us, you need to be an Australian citizen and be prepared to complete an ASIC Suitability and Baseline Assessment.

View the position description for more information or click ‘apply' to start your application. Applications close at 11:59pm AEDT, Sunday 22 February.

Great Permanent opportunity for a Data Architecture & Strategy Lead to join a high growth technology first Scale up based in Sydney, flexible hybrid role.
We’re partnering with a high growth, technology led financial services scale up that is investing heavily in its data platform to support the next phase of business growth, automation, and AI driven capability.

The Opportunity
This is a hands-on senior data leadership role where you will own data architecture and strategy end to end, with a clear mandate to fix foundational issues, modernise the data stack, and build the platform required to scale with confidence. If you enjoy solving hard data problems, making pragmatic architectural decisions, and balancing speed, cost, and long-term value, this role will suit you.

You will take ownership of the core data architecture and work closely with engineering, product, and business leaders to design and implement a modern, scalable data foundation. This role is execution focused and not purely advisory. You will be expected to design, build, and stabilise key components yourself.

You will also play a critical role in enabling future AI, automation, and advanced analytics use cases by ensuring the right data foundations, governance, and observability are in place.

What You’ll Be Doing

Data Architecture and Platform Strategy
• Own and evolve the overall data architecture and technical direction
• Make clear build vs buy decisions based on cost, latency, and business value
• Re architect legacy ETL and ELT pipelines to improve freshness, reliability, and cost efficiency

Automation and AI Enablement
• Design data ingestion and serving layers to support modern automation and AI workloads
• Account for latency and reliability requirements beyond traditional BI and reporting
• Prepare the data platform to support future RAG and agent-based use cases

Data Governance and Quality
• Establish practical data contracts with product and engineering teams
• Drive data quality ownership to the point of creation rather than downstream cleanup
• Implement data observability, lineage, and traceability to improve trust and explainability

Commercial and Cost Ownership
• Own data platform costs and vendor decisions
• Balance innovation with cost discipline and operational efficiency

What We’re Looking For

Strong experience in data architecture and hands on data engineering/ Science leadership
• Proven ability to modernise data platforms in scaling or complex environments
• Experience making pragmatic architectural decisions under real business constraints
• Solid understanding of modern data stacks, cloud data platforms, and automation
• Exposure to unstructured data, AI adjacent workloads, or advanced analytics is highly regarded
• Strong stakeholder management skills and the ability to influence without authority
• A lean, outcome focused mindset over technical perfection
Interviews for this role will be starting next week so if you would like to know more about the company and opportunity apply Today and ill give you a call. For more information speak to Jamie at Preacta recruitment 0401488853

Brighter Futures Start Here

We are an inclusive team who power two of the most iconic and loved brands, Kmart and Target. We have more than 50,000 passionate individuals across our stores, distribution centres, and offices around the globe.

With our brands touching the lives of almost two million customers every week, you'll feel the impact of the work you'll do every day. As a leader in the retail market, we're optimistic about our future and yours. We're changing at a rapid rate, giving you challenging work that you'll be proud of.

Join the team


We're now looking for a Merchandise Business Analyst to join our Merchandise Reporting, Data & Platforms team. This is a critical role that supports key business processes across Merchandise and Inventory, while partnering closely with Stores & Operations, Profit Protection, Marketing, IT, Finance and Supply Chain.

What you'll be doing

In this hands‑on analyst role, you'll play a key part in maintaining the integrity, quality and usability of merchandise data while enabling accurate reporting and insights across the business.

You will:

Support critical merchandise and inventory business processes, ensuring strong data integrity and adherence to business rules
Provide expert advice, SME support and training to merchandise teams across data, platforms and reporting tools
Maintain and improve key documentation, standards and user manuals to support governance and ways of working
Manage and analyse large, complex datasets using advanced Excel, SQL and Power BI to support business intelligence outcomes
Collaborate with a wide range of stakeholders including Merchandise, Inventory, Stores & Operations, Profit Protection, Marketing and IT
Support and enhance merchandise reporting infrastructure and BI solutions in a fast‑paced retail environment
Play a key role in delivering the new Merchandise Data Strategy, designed to transform how merchandise data is managed across Kmart and Target
Identify continuous improvement opportunities and help deliver sustainable, value‑adding data solutions

To be successful in this role you'll have:

5-7 years' experience in a Business Analyst, Merchandise Analyst or similar role within retail
A strong background in Merchandise and/or Inventory (essential)
Advanced Excel skills, including pivot tables, slicers and macros
Practical experience writing and interpreting SQL queries
Capability in Power BI and business intelligence reporting
Hands‑on experience with merchandise systems and data platforms
Proven ability to manage competing priorities in a high‑volume, fast‑paced environment
Excellent stakeholder engagement skills, with the ability to communicate, influence and collaborate across technical and non‑technical teams
Strong critical thinking, problem‑solving and organisational skills
A tertiary qualification in Business, Information Technology or a related discipline (preferred)

Benefits we'll offer you:

Flexible hybrid working options through our Flex Where, Flex When, Flex Well policy.
A team member discount card that gives you a discount at Kmart, Target, Officeworks and Bunnings
Access to the Kmart for You benefits program which entitles you to exclusive discounts and benefits in the areas of entertainment, travel, lifestyle, and health - with over 60 suppliers!
We want you to feel rewarded for your commitment and hard work that's why eligible team members get the opportunity to participate in a bonus program
We offer inclusive parental leave, and ongoing support offered though our partnership with Circle In for team members of all backgrounds and family circumstances
A dynamic learning and support program
Opportunity to fast track your career through our Mentor Program as a Mentee or Mentor
A Kudos recognition program, where you are nominated by your peers to spin a wheel, to win a stack of cool prizes
Great career opportunities across the broader Wesfarmers Group


We celebrate the rich diversity of the communities in which we operate. We are committed to creating inclusive and safe environments where all our team members can contribute and succeed. We believe that all team members should feel valued, respected and safe, and strive to ensure our recruitment process is accessible and welcoming, with applications encouraged from all candidates.

We encourage you to tell us about any workplace adjustments that you would like, by emailing kmartgroupcareers@kmart.com.au.

If you would like to explore a career with Kmart and this sounds like the perfect role for you - apply now!

Working with us - Systems Planning & Analysis (SPA) Australia

SPA Australia is a leading provider of integrated consulting, legal, commercial and analytics services to government and large organisations. Our multidisciplinary approach combined with trusted advisory and leading-edge technology and analysis takes our clients further. For more than five decades, Systems Planning & Analysis (SPA) has supported clients across the world to meet complex national security challenges. 

In 2025 SPA acquired Proximity Advisory Services, a well-established and highly regarded consultancy organisation with unrivalled legal abilities, exceptional commercial capability, and a raft of specialisations in consulting. Today, SPA has a global footprint, including more than 130 employees based across Canberra, Melbourne, Sydney and Adelaide.  

SPA Australia’s Defence & Analytics team provides senior decision-makers within the Australian Department of Defence (Defence) with timely, objective assessments that inform capability employment and investment strategies. 

Our team of former military professionals and operations research analysts integrates deep operational expertise with advanced analytic methodologies—including force generation modelling, agent-based tactical simulations, and operational mission analyses—to deliver trusted decision support that directly contributes to national security outcomes. 

SPA Australia offers decision-makers within the Australian Defence Force evidence-based insights that address capacity and capability gaps, strengthen operational effectiveness, and optimise the deployment of current, and future Defence capabilities. 

SPA seeks a passionate and dedicated Director to join our Defence & Analytics practice. This senior role provides strategic leadership to high-performance, cross-functional teams conducting advanced quantitative and qualitative analyses of Australian and adversary military operations and capabilities across all warfighting domains, missions, and functional areas. 

The Director will lead multiple concurrent workstreams—often under tight timelines—while rapidly assimilating new information, technologies, and concepts. The role requires the ability to anticipate emerging analytical needs, balance immediate customer priorities, and consistently deliver rigorous, defensible insights that inform senior decision-makers at strategic and operational levels. 

This role will suit an experienced defence professional with demonstrated fluency across priority military operations and the enabling capabilities that underpin them. The successful candidate will also play a critical role in business development, leveraging existing networks to identify opportunities, strengthen client relationships, and contribute to the growth of the Defence & Analytics practice.

Key Responsibilities: 

Provide strategic leadership to cross-functional teams conducting complex analysis across all warfighting domains assessing Australian and adversary military operations, capabilities and capacities. 

Foster a mission-focused, high-performance culture and provide strong leadership to project teams. 

Demonstrate and apply deep expertise in military operations and support and enabling capability roadmaps 

Build high level relationships with senior Defence stakeholders and be a trusted advisor. 

Support Defence clients in the planning, design, and execution of experimentation and operational analysis aligned with joint force design and integration priorities.  

Facilitate stakeholder engagements, including workshops and demonstrations. 

Oversee multiple concurrent analytical workstreams, ensuring timely delivery of rigorous, defensible analysis that supports strategic and operational decision-making. 

Write capability analysis reports and briefs and present results to stakeholders from a wide range of Defence organisation and varying levels of domain expertise 

Support clients in implementing operational and tactical plans that contribute to national security objectives. 

Identify strategic growth opportunities across the joint domain and lead growth within the defence joint operations market.  

Required Experience: 

Must be an Australian citizen

15 + years relevant Australia Defence and Australia Federal Government experience in military operations and associated technologies

Demonstrated expertise in providing one or more warfighting domains, missions, or functional areas to the Australia Defence Force

Background in capability development, systems engineering, operations or mission analysis

Proven ability to conduct rigorous research and analysis and form defensible conclusions using available, often incomplete, information

Strong written and verbal communication skills, producing compelling and clear analytic products and briefings to support senior-leadership decision-making

Experience leading small teams and projects in support of Australian Defence capabilities, or Australia Federal Government key projects

Demonstrated ability to apply innovative analytical concepts, quantitative tools, and data visualisation methods to military problem sets and present results to executive-level leaders

Experience in Australian military operational planning within an operational headquarters or in Australian Defence capability management (including requirements definition, capability documentation, modelling and simulation, or operations research)

International Defence cooperation initiatives experience highly regarded

Current Negative Vetting 2 (NV2) Australian security clearance, or willingness and ability to obtain and maintain one

Desired Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in a STEM discipline; or substantial military experience plus an advanced non-technical degree and proven Defence capability acumen (e.g., completion of the Capability Technology Management Program or equivalent) 

Current Positive Vetting (PV) Australian security clearance

Note: International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) and/or Export Administration Regulations (EAR) are applicable to this role and as such, the position will or is likely to require access to material controlled by ITAR and EAR (Controlled Material).  Therefore, any person occupying the position must be able to satisfy ITAR and EAR controls, which may require specific authorisation to access Controlled Materials.  Accordingly, your citizenship, previous citizenships, race or nationality, or substantive contacts where such contacts are affiliated with proscribed countries under ITAR may be a factor in determining your suitability for this role. Further information on this requirement can be found at: https://spa.com/about/compliance-statements/. If you are concerned about whether you will satisfy the requirements of the role insofar as they relate to ITAR and EAR, you should contact Talent@spa.com, who will be able to provide you with relevant information. 

Working with SPA Australia

Collaborating with our clients to overcome challenges and achieve excellent outcomes is what matters most. We create an exceptional workplace culture that empowers our people with the confidence and knowledge to find the ‘right fit’ solution for client needs. We’re committed to a safe and respectful workplace where everyone – regardless of identity, orientation, background, or ability – feels valued and accepted. Our values are central to everything we do. We strengthen our culture and client advantage by being Genuine, taking a Bold Approach, and delivering Helpful outcomes in an Objective, Trusted, and Responsive way.




The SPA Australia Difference

We believe work should be a positive part of your life. It should challenge, engage, and support you in equal measure. By joining SPA Australia, you’ll enjoy:

Flexible working options

Health and wellbeing support – financial and educational

Professional development, support and funding

Career progression pathways supporting your development and career goals

The chance to give back to your community by working with our not-for-profit partners 

Does this sound like the right organisation for you?

We provide a highly competitive executive compensation package, performance-based incentives, a collaborative and supportive leadership environment, comprehensive employee benefits, and the opportunity to oversee work that delivers significant strategic impact and meaningful outcomes. 

To find out more or to have a confidential discussion, please contact Loretta Pabian at careers@au.spa.com

Our client is looking for Senior Data Architect to lead a large scale enterprise digital modernisation program. This role will lead all data discovery, design, development and go-live activities as the organisation transitions from legacy systems to a new flagship CRM/BPM digital platform.

Key Responsibilities:
Lead design, development and documentation for platform data services from concept to production.
Develop robust data pipelines, integrations, models and patterns that support a modern CRM/BPM platform.
Troubleshoot complex issues and recommend opportunities for ongoing data lifecycle improvement.
Manage data assets in alignment with organisational data governance standards and architectural frameworks.
Collaborate with agency-level data and architecture leads to ensure compliance and alignment with regulatory and security requirements.
Position requirements:

Previous experience as a Data Architect across Enterprise Data Migration projects
Experience in AWS and Azure
Experience with Salesforce or similar CRM
Strong foundation in data engineering, including data modelling, database design, ETL pipelines, data warehousing and integration patterns.
Previous experience in Government is highly regarded

Super Retail Group is the proud owner of four iconic brands: Supercheap Auto, rebel, BCF and Macpac, and is one of Australia and New Zealand's largest retailers. The talent of our teams and their passion for providing an experience which inspires and enhances our customers’ leisure time drives our culture of innovation and opportunity. 

About the Role

Due to an internal career progression, we are seeking a Senior Data Governance Specialist to play a critical role in strengthening and embedding enterprise‑wide data governance capabilities across Super Retail Group (SRG).

Acting as a senior subject matter expert, this role will lead the delivery of the Data Governance Foundations program, partnering closely with key stakeholders to enable trusted, high‑quality data as a strategic asset. Reporting to the GM Data & AI, you will be the custodian of the data governance tool, providing authoritative guidance on policies and standards, and driving consistent adoption of data governance and data quality management practices across the organisation.

Your key responsibilities will include but not be limited to:

Contributing to the development of policies, standards and guidelines for strategy development and planning.

Implementing the data governance framework to enable data governance activity to be conducted.

Providing expert advice and guidance on implementing personal data legislation controls in products, services, and systems.

Owning and driving the adoption of data quality management processes, providing support to data stewards and custodians to identify root causes for data quality issues as well as defining the risks and business impacts.

Managing problems and issues, overseeing resolutions, corrective actions, lessons learned, and the collection and dissemination of relevant information.

This role is ideally based in Brisbane (Strathpine); however, we would also consider candidates based in Sydney (Rhodes), with a hybrid work model.

About You

We are seeking a Senior Data Governance Specialist who can influence stakeholders, navigate complex environments, and build strong, trusted relationships. The role requires a customer‑centric mindset and the ability to consider customer impacts when shaping governance decisions, solutions, and continuous improvement initiatives.

In addition, you have:

Experience in technical business analysis, including requirements elicitation, stakeholder management, and workshop facilitation, applying consulting skills to diagnose issues, shape options, and influence outcomes.

Experience working with collaborative tools that promote transparency, visibility, and continuous improvement.

Experience in developing, implementing, and maintaining Data Governance best practices.

Strong skills in technical analysis and data investigation, including identifying data quality issues, root causes, and resolution recommendations.

Experience in implementing and maintaining Data Governance tooling.

WHY JOIN US? 

You’ll get to join for an organisation with a culture that is driven by innovation and creating awesome experiences for our customers and teams, and will get to work alongside a diverse team across Super Retail Group that is representative of the communities we work in. 

Super Retail Group is a Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA) Employer of Choice for Gender Equality citation holder. 

We are committed to your professional development and will support on-going opportunities for both learning and progression. 

You will get access to generous discounts across all Super Retail Group brands, as well as access to our Perks Programme, including discounts on Health and Wellbeing, Entertainment, Travel and Accommodation and more. 

Our Culture of Inclusion

Super Retail Group is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We support, promote and celebrate diversity and we recognise the benefits a culture of inclusion brings to our workplace and customer experience. 

How to apply

Interested candidates for this role should apply by following the links and sending your resume.
